Package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.windows

Class TumblingSortOperator

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.window.AbstractWindowOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.windows.TumblingSortOperator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operator
@PrimitiveOperator(name="TumblingSort", description="Sample ascending sort operator for a tumbling window.", comment=" Licensed Materials - Property of IBM (C) Copyright Teracloud ApS 2024, 2024, IBM Corp. 2010, 2012 All Rights Reserved. US Government Users Restricted Rights - Use, duplication or disclosure restricted by GSA ADP Schedule Contract with IBM Corp. ") @InputPortSet(cardinality=1, windowingMode=Windowed, windowPunctuationInputMode=WindowBound) @OutputPortSet(cardinality=1, windowPunctuationOutputMode=Generating) public class TumblingSortOperator extends AbstractWindowOperator
Sample ascending sort operator for a tumbling window. Extends AbstractWindowOperator to ensure all tuples and punctuation are handled by the StreamWindowListener.
TumblingWindowSort is used as the StreamWindowListener with the parameter sortAttributes defining the set of attributes used for ordering. The first attribute in the list is the most significant in the sort order. All the attributes must correspond to a java.lang.Comparable object type.
The optional boolean parameter flushOnFinal indicates if the remaining tuples in the window should be flushed and submitted to the output port in sorted order when a final punctuation mark is received. The default is false which means tuples remaining in the window are discarded upon a final mark. Set to true to flush remaining tuples.

Requires a single tumbling windowed input port and a single output port.

This operator provided as the sample Java primitive operator
com.ibm.streams.javaprimitivesamples.windows.TumblingSort
in the sample JavaOperators toolkit located in:
$STREAMS_INSTALL/samples/spl/feature/JavaOperators
